question:
Consider the following differences between a private limited company and a public limited company:
  1. While there is restriction on the right to transfer of shares in private limited company, there is no such restriction in case of public limited company
  2. While there is no obligation on statutory meeting in private limited company, statutory meeting is obligatory in a public limited company
  Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation:
Both are correct statements
  • While a private limited company restricts the right to transfer its shares, there is no such restriction in case of public limited company
  • While there is no restriction on Managerial remuneration in a private company, the managerial remuneration cannot exceed more than 11% of net profits in a public company
  • While there is no obligation on statutory meeting in private limited company, statutory meeting is obligatory in a public limited company
